en: You slept upstairs last night. It felt like a betrayal leaving Sandra downstairs, but you couldn’t spend another night on the floor next to her.
zh: 昨晚你睡在樓上，把桑德拉獨自留在樓下讓你有一種背叛她的感覺，但你不能再待在地板上陪她一晚上了。

en: You just couldn’t.
zh: 你只是不能。

en: You didn’t sleep well, just in fits and starts, and you lost count of how many times you reached across the bed, needing to find Sandra asleep and okay and not being able to.
zh: 你沒有睡好，半夢半醒，你數不清有多少次把手伸到床的那邊，確定桑德拉正在睡覺，確定她沒事，然而，她並不在那裡。

en: When you went into the office this morning, you went with the hope she wouldn’t be there, that she would be cooking breakfast or reading a book.
zh: 你今天早上去寫作房時，但願她不在那裡，她應該在做早餐或者讀書。

en: But of course she was there, she’s still here.
zh: 可她仍舊躺在那裡。

en: You sat on the floor next to her and spun the chamber in the gun around and around, thinking about putting it to your head and pulling the trigger, but never getting close.
zh: 你坐在她旁邊的地板上，一圈又一圈地轉動槍筒，想著把槍頂在你的頭上，扣動扳機，但做不到。

en: The alarm guys came to the house yesterday. At least you think it was them.
zh: 安裝警報器的那些傢伙昨天到家裡來了，至少你覺得是他們。

en: There was knocking from the front door a few times that you ignored.
zh: 前門響了好幾次敲門聲，你都置之不理。

en: They eventually went away.
zh: 最終他們只得走了。

en: Last night you called Eva and gave her the We’re busy looking at nursing homes line, and she wished you the best of luck.
zh: 昨晚，你打電話給伊娃，對她說「我們正忙著找療養院」，她祝你好運。

en: The moment you call the police you will lose her.
zh: 一旦你打電話報警了，你就會失去她。

en: You are in limbo now, just spending the hours imagining your life without Sandra.
zh: 你現在心神不定，不知所措，只花幾個小時想象沒有桑德拉的生活該怎麼過。

en: But that was your future anyway, wasn’t it?
zh: 但不管怎樣，那是你的未來了，不是嗎？

en: So here’s what’s going to happen, Madness Journal.
zh: 所以，這就是接下來會發生的事了，「狂人日記」。

en: This will be Past Jerry’s final entry before being shipped off to jail, his final few lines before calling the police later today.
zh: 這是過去的傑瑞在被送進監獄之前最後的手筆。今天晚些時候，或是明天，他將會打電話報警。

en: The longer the wait, the more time Eva can have thinking the world is okay.
zh: 拖的時間越長，伊娃認為一切還好的時間就會越久。

en: So, what to say to the police?
zh: 那麼，對警察說些什麼呢？

en: Say nothing.
zh: 什麼也別說。

en: Don’t tell them anything.
zh: 什麼也不要告訴他們。

en: If this is all you remember, Future Jerry, then remember this: don’t tell them about Belinda, about the shirt, the knife, about Hans.
zh: 如果你能記得的話，未來的傑瑞，千萬牢記：不要告訴他們關於貝琳達的事，也不要告訴他們關於襯衫、刀和漢斯的事。

en: It’s their job to figure out what happened, and if you lay all the evidence out there for them, they won’t look beyond it.
zh: 弄清楚發生了什麼是他們的工作，如果你把所有的證據都供出來，他們就會認定你是兇手，不會再去尋找其他的證據了。

en: You’ll go from Jerry Grey Crime Writer to Jerry Grey Death Row Inmate. You’ll be a scapegoat.
zh: 你會由犯罪小說家變成死囚犯，變成替罪羊。

en: They’re not going to believe you had nothing to do with Belinda Murray’s death, and they’ll shape the evidence around Nurse Mae’s statement.
zh: 他們不會相信你與貝琳達·穆雷的死無關，他們會根據梅護士的敘述來確定經過。

en: They’ll say the timeline was off, that you were there earlier or Belinda died later.
zh: 他們會說時間剛好吻合，說你之前到過那裡，或貝琳達在你離開之後死了。

en: You’ve written about this world long enough to know how it works.
zh: 很久以前你就開始描寫這個充滿罪惡的世界了，你知道是怎麼回事。

en: Say nothing. Who knows, in another month or two maybe you’ll have forgotten all about this.
zh: 再過一兩個月也許你會忘記這一切的。

en: Stop writing what you know.
zh: 不要再寫你熟悉的事情了。

en: They run downstairs, each of them stumbling, Jerry tripping into Hans, Hans tripping into Jerry, more good luck than anything else keeping them upright as Hans’s cell phone lights the way. When they get to the bottom they don’t actually know where to turn.
zh: 他們跑到樓下，兩個人都被絆了一下，傑瑞絆了漢斯，漢斯絆了傑瑞，不過因為有漢斯的手機照路，兩個人都沒有摔倒。

en: They don’t know the layout of the place.
zh: 他們來到了一樓，還不知道該向哪裡走，因為他們根本不知道這個地方的布局如何。

en: Hans makes the decision and Jerry follows.
zh: 漢斯選了個方向，傑瑞表示同意。

en: They head into what turns out to be the dining room, then the lounge, no furniture to bang their knees into.
zh: 他們走進餐廳，接著是客廳，沒有傢具磕碰他們的膝蓋。

en: From the lounge there’s a sliding door to the backyard.
zh: 客廳里有一道推拉門通向後院。

en: Both men are breathing heavily. Neither has said a word.
zh: 兩個人都不住地喘著粗氣，誰也沒有說話。

en: Because Eric’s hands were tied behind him, he never had the chance to try to use his arms to break his fall.
zh: 由於艾瑞克的手被綁在身後，他沒有機會用手臂減弱撞向地面的衝擊力。

en: There is no need to check for a pulse.
zh: 沒有必要檢查脈搏了。

en: Jerry can feel something rise up in his stomach.
zh: 傑瑞可以感覺到他胃裡在翻騰。

en: “Hold it in, Jerry,” Hans says.
zh: 「憋住，傑瑞。」漢斯說。

en: Jerry takes a deep breath. He tries to hold it in. But he can’t.
zh: 傑瑞深吸了一口氣，他想憋住，但無能為力。

en: He turns and vomits against the side of the house.
zh: 他轉過身，對著牆嘔吐。

en: He can still hear the sound Eric’s head made when it hit the pavement, can feel that sound vibrating around the bones in his body, like biting heavily on a ball bearing and cracking a tooth. He wipes his sleeve over his mouth.
zh: 艾瑞克的頭部撞擊地面的碰撞聲，混著他身體里骨頭的折斷聲仍在他耳邊迴響，那聲音就像在滾動軸承上狠狠地咬上一口崩掉牙齒一樣。

en: His hands are shaking, and then he realizes his legs are shaking. His arms too. Everything is shaking.
zh: 他用衣袖擦嘴，手不停地顫抖，他意識到自己的腿也在顫抖，全身都在顫抖。

en: This is what it is like to have killed a person. If he’s done this before, surely he’d recognize the feeling.
zh: 這就像是親手殺死一個人的感覺，如果他之前殺過人，他肯定會熟悉這種感覺的。

en: “Why the hell did you let him go?” Hans asks.
zh: 「你為什麼鬆手讓他摔下來？」漢斯問。

en: “Don’t put this on me,” Jerry says.
zh: 「別賴我。」傑瑞說，「我從來沒有干過這種事。

en: “It’s not like I have experience at this kind of thing. This is why in movies the guys doing the holding look like bodybuilders.”
zh: 這就是為什麼在電影中做這種事的人看起來像是健美運動員。」

en: “All you had to do was hold on.”
zh: 「你堅持就行了。」

en: “Well dangling him outside the window was a stupid idea.”
zh: 「本來讓他在窗外晃來晃去就是一個愚蠢的想法。」

en: “Yeah?
zh: 「是嗎？

en: You want to carry on doing this alone?”
zh: 你想自己單獨完成這件事嗎？」

en: Hans asks. “You think you’re better off without me?”
zh: 漢斯問，「你覺得沒有我你會做得更好？」

en: “No, of course not,” Jerry says.
zh: 「不，當然不是。」傑瑞說，「我只是不知道我們會殺人。

en: “I just didn’t know we were going to be killing anybody. We just murdered him, Hans.”
zh: 我們剛殺了他，漢斯。」

en: “Damn it, Jerry, I know that, okay?
zh: 「媽的，傑瑞，我知道好嗎？

en: But before you head to church to confess, just remember what he did.
zh: 在你去教堂懺悔之前，只需要記得他做了什麼。

en: He killed those women and framed you for it.”
zh: 他殺了那些女人，並栽贓誣陷你。」

en: “But we don’t know that,” Jerry says, “not for a fact, and even if that is true who the hell is going to believe us, huh?”
zh: 傑瑞說：「但是我們並不知道，即便是真的，誰他媽會相信我們？」

en: “Come on, let’s go,” Hans says.
zh: 漢斯說：「好了，我們走吧。」

en: “And what?
zh: 「什麼？

en: Just leave him out here?”
zh: 把他留在這裏？」

en: “We need to make use of the time we have,” Hans says.
zh: 「我們需要充分把握好時間。」

en: “Soon his wife is going to start wondering where he is, then she’s going to start phoning around, and in a few hours she’ll probably be calling the police. They’re going to make the connection pretty quickly since both of you have gone missing,” Hans says.
zh: 漢斯說，「他的老婆很快就會開始懷疑他去了哪裡，她會打電話的，幾個小時后她可能會報警。

en: “We can’t just leave him like this,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我們不能這樣把他留在這裏。」傑瑞說，「這樣做不對。」

en: “There’s no point in dumping him anywhere,” Hans says.
zh: 「把他丟在什麼地方並不重要。」

en: “We’re going to have to admit to what happened, but once the police figure out the kind of man he really was, then that’ll go in our favor. Plus it was an accident.”
zh: 漢斯說，「我們將不得不承認發生了什麼，不過一旦警察查明了他是什麼人，那麼這會對我們很有利，再加上這隻是一個意外。」

en: “I don’t mean dumping him anywhere,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我不是說把他丟在什麼地方。」傑瑞說，「只是，我們不能把他留在露台上，這樣不對。」

en: “None of this is right,” Hans says, then he disappears inside.
zh: 「一切的一切都不對。」漢斯說，他消失在黑暗裡。

en: He crouches down and tries to be sick again, but there’s nothing, just bile.
zh: 他蹲下身去，想再嘔吐，但什麼也沒有了，吐出來的只是膽汁。

en: When Hans comes back he’s carrying a shower curtain.
zh: 漢斯回來的時候，他手裡拿著一張浴簾。

en: They roll Eric into the shower curtain, his body making clicking sounds as broken bones roll over each other.
zh: 他們用浴簾把艾瑞克裹了起來，翻身時斷裂的骨頭髮出咔嚓咔嚓的聲音。

en: Jerry picks Eric’s broken glasses off the ground and puts them in Eric’s hand.
zh: 傑瑞從地上撿起艾瑞克的壞眼鏡，放回他手裡。

en: The wrapped feet keep slipping out of Jerry’s grip and hitting the ground.
zh: 那裹著的雙腳時不時地從傑瑞的手中滑落，撞到地上。

en: Somehow the dead man feels heavier than he did five minutes ago.
zh: 不知怎的，那死人的分量比五分鐘前更沉重了。

en: Jerry fills his hands with layers of plastic rather than trying to scoop them under the body.
zh: 傑瑞不再從下面托著屍體了，而是抓住一層層的塑料提著。

en: No matter what is real and what isn’t, Jerry just killed a man.
zh: 不管是不是真的，傑瑞已經殺人了。

en: Hans uses his phone to light their way back through the house. They don’t say anything as they walk out the front.
zh: 漢斯用手機照著路，他們走出房子，到了前院，兩人誰也沒有說話。

en: Hans closes the door behind him and the lock latches back into place.
zh: 漢斯關上身後的門，上好鎖閂。

en: They walk casually to the car and climb casually in and then casually drive out of the street—nothing to see here, nothing going on, no sir, no ma’am, just two law-abiding citizens out for a drive after casually dropping somebody to their death.
zh: 他們倆若無其事地走到車旁上車，接著若無其事地駛向街道。沒有什麼可看的，一切風平浪靜，沒有什麼，先生們、女士們，只有兩個守法的公民把人摔死後若無其事地駕車離去。

en: Jerry can’t tell whether Hans is going to take him right to the police or hang him out a different window all by himself. In fact he has no idea where Hans is going.
zh: 他不知道漢斯要去哪裡，弄不清楚現在漢斯是要把他帶到警局，還是要把他吊到另一個窗口去。

en: They drive for fifteen minutes and Jerry watches the houses and the cars parked out front and the occasional person wandering along, and he craves all of it.
zh: 他們開車行駛了十五分鐘，傑瑞艷羡地看著一幢幢經過的房子，停在兩邊的一輛輛車，還有漫步著的行人，眼前的一切都令他艷羡不已。

en: He wants to wrap himself up in that life, the normality of thinking about dinner and TV and the onslaught of bills.
zh: 他也想讓自己融進那樣正常的生活，想想晚餐吃什麼、電視看什麼以及鋪天蓋地的賬單。

en: He wants to be Jerry Grey back before Captain A steered him into the dark.
zh: 他想要做回傑瑞·格雷，在「阿爾茨船長」把他埋葬到黑暗中之前。

en: “We’re here,” Hans says.
zh: 「我們到了。」漢斯說。

en: “Where?”
zh: 「這是哪裡？」

en: “Eric’s house,” Hans says, turning the car into the driveway.
zh: 「艾瑞克家。」漢斯說著把汽車駛入車道。

en: He presses the button on the remote to open the garage door.
zh: 他按下遙控器上的按鈕打開車庫門。

en: “We’re committed, buddy, and we’ve come too far to turn back now.” “You’re kidding.”
zh: 「我們是一根繩上的螞蚱了，夥計，我們已經騎虎難下了。」

en: “How long have we known each other?”
zh: 「你在開玩笑吧？」「我們互相認識多久了？」漢斯問。

en: “You’re fifty,” Hans says, and the news is almost as upsetting as any other he’s had today.
zh: 「你五十歲。」漢斯說，這個新聞幾乎像今天的其他消息一樣令他不安，「你難道不知道你小時候就認識我了？」

en: “Honestly, I can’t remember that either.”
zh: 「我真的不記得了。」

en: Hans laughs at that. “God I wish that was a joke.
zh: 漢斯笑了：「天啊，我倒真希望這是個玩笑。

en: Come on, let’s start looking around.”
zh: 來，我們到處看看。」

en: “Didn’t you say he was married?”
zh: 「你不是說他結婚了嗎？」

en: “I did, but look—do you see any lights on?
zh: 「我是說了，但你看到房裡有燈亮著嗎？

en: And there’s no other car in the garage.
zh: 車庫裡也沒有其他車。

en: Come on.”
zh: 來吧。」

en: “Doesn’t mean she isn’t home.”
zh: 「是不是說明她不在家？」

en: “The house is empty,” Hans says.
zh: 「房子里沒人。」漢斯說。

en: “How can you be so sure?”
zh: 「你怎麼這麼肯定？」

en: “I can just tell. It’s like a secret power.”
zh: 「我就是知道，就像特異功能。」

en: “But isn’t that what you thought earlier when you first came here only to find Eric inside?”
zh: 「你是不是早就想到了，因為你第一次來時發現只有艾瑞克一個人在家？」

en: “It’s a secret power that is occasionally wrong.
zh: 「這是特異功能，偶爾也有出錯的時候。

en: Like I said, Jerry, we’re committed.”
zh: 就像我說的，傑瑞，我們承擔著責任。」

en: They drive into the garage. Hans pushes the button to close the door behind them.
zh: 他們開車進入車庫，漢斯按下按鈕關上他們身後的門。

en: “So what’s the plan?” Jerry asks.
zh: 傑瑞問：「那麼計劃是什麼？」

en: “The plan is we don’t mess things up,” Hans says.
zh: 漢斯說：「計劃就是我們不要把事情搞砸。」

en: “And if the wife is home?” Jerry asks.
zh: 傑瑞問道：「要是他妻子在家呢？」

en: “Then that will be a problem,” Hans says, “but thankfully we have these,” he says, and pops open the glove box and pulls out the leather pouch with the syringes inside.
zh: 「這是個問題，」漢斯說，「但還好我們有這些。」他說著，打開手套箱，取出裝有注射器的皮革袋。

en: “These aren’t mine. I found them in here earlier. They’re Eric’s.
zh: 漢斯搖搖頭：「不是我的，是我之前在這裏發現的，是艾瑞克的。

en: They’re what he sedated you with.
zh: 他就是用這些給你注射鎮靜劑。

en: No reason for him to have them in his car, right?”
zh: 但他沒有理由把它們留在車裡，對吧？」

en: “He had his car yesterday,” Jerry says, “when he came to the house.”
zh: 「他昨天回家時還開車來著。」傑瑞說。

en: “And he should have returned them to the nursing home, but he didn’t, because they are for his own personal use.”
zh: 「那他應該把它們送還療養院，但是他沒有，因為是他自己擅自使用。」

en: “What if we use one on his wife and she’s allergic to it, or we overdose her?”
zh: 「我們給他的妻子用了，萬一她對藥物過敏，或者我們過量使用了該怎麼辦呢？」

en: “That’s not going to happen.”
zh: 「這種事不會發生的。」

en: “How can you be so sure?”
zh: 「你怎麼可以這麼肯定？」

en: “So what do you want to do, Jerry?
zh: 「那麼你想怎樣呢，傑瑞？

en: Go to jail and let the world think you killed those women when it was Eric?
zh: 乖乖坐牢，讓世人認為是你殺了那些女人？難道不是艾瑞克乾的？

en: The chances are she’s not even home, and the longer we sit in the car debating it, the closer she’s getting. We could have been in and out by now.
zh: 她甚至可能不在家，我們坐在車上辯論的時間越長，就越有可能碰見她。

en: Come on, we have to go in and prove he did these things.”
zh: 來，我們必須進去，證明他殺了人。」

en: “And what if he didn’t?”
zh: 「萬一他沒有呢？」

en: “Then we just killed an innocent man. There’s no point in holding back.
zh: 「那我們只是殺了個無辜的人，現在打退堂鼓沒有任何意義了，我們騎虎難下了。」

en: They move into the house, the internal door bringing them into a hallway.
zh: 他們進到屋裡，穿過內門，進入走廊。

en: Hans flicks on a light.
zh: 漢斯輕輕打開一盞燈。

en: Jerry notices his friend is still wearing gloves.
zh: 傑瑞注意到他的朋友還戴著手套。

en: “See?
zh: 「看到了吧？

en: I told you it was empty.”
zh: 我告訴你房裡沒人。」

en: “Shouldn’t we leave the lights off?”
zh: 「我們是不是應該把燈關掉？」

en: “Why?
zh: 「為什麼？

en: Eric was supposed to be home, right?
zh: 艾瑞克應該在家啊，對吧？

en: It’d be weird if the lights weren’t on.”
zh: 如果燈不亮的話反而會很奇怪吧。」

en: “Yeah, I guess.”
zh: 「我想是的。」

en: “You go search the study,” Hans says. “I’ll start elsewhere.”
zh: 「你去搜書房，」漢斯說，「我從別處開始。」

en: The study is the first room on the left.
zh: 書房在左手邊的第一個房間。

en: There’s a bookcase on the wall and Jerry’s books are there, plus those of others, a bunch of authors Jerry has met and had drinks with at festivals, a bunch of true crime novels, some how-to and tips on writing.
zh: 牆上有一個書櫃，上面擺放著傑瑞的書，還有一些其他作者的書，一些傑瑞認識，並且逢年過節還一塊兒喝過酒。此外還有一些真正的犯罪小說，一些關於寫作技巧的書。

en: There’s a desk facing them. It’s solid wood with scars and scratches and dents.
zh: 書架的對面有一張書桌，木質堅實，布滿疤痕、划痕和凹痕。

en: It looks old, all that character beaten into it over the last hundred years.
zh: 它看起來年代久遠，所有的字元幾乎都有上百年的歷史了。

en: Behind the desk is an office chair on wheels, and on top of the desk a computer, a printer, a couple of novels, a bottle of water, a phone, and a printed out manuscript.
zh: 桌子後面是一張滾輪辦公椅，桌上有台電腦和印表機，一些小說、一瓶水、一部電話和一份列印好的手稿。

en: On top of the manuscript is a snow globe a little bigger than a baseball, a castle on the inside of it, the flecks of glitter lying prone on the bottom.
zh: 手稿旁邊是一個水晶球，比棒球要大一點兒，可以看見裏面有一座城堡，底部是閃光的斑點。

en: The room is carpeted, which makes it unlikely there are any hiding spaces beneath the floorboards, but he still kicks at it anyway, listening for something that might give, but there’s nothing.
zh: 房間里鋪著地毯，地板下面不像是有任何暗格，但他還是用腳踢著，側耳聆聽下面會不會發出空洞的聲音，但什麼也沒有。

en: He sits in Eric’s chair. He starts with the drawers.
zh: 他坐在艾瑞克的椅子上，從抽屜開始搜起。

en: There are some magazines, some office supplies, some bank statements.
zh: 裏面有一些雜誌、辦公用品、銀行賬單。

en: No jewelry, no strange porn or photographs of neighbors through windows.
zh: 沒有珠寶，也沒有詭異的色情雜誌或通過窗戶偷|拍鄰居的照片。

en: He picks up the manuscript. It’s bulky.
zh: 他拿起手稿，很沉。

en: It’s been many books since he last printed out a manuscript. He used to do all his editing and reading on the computer.
zh: 他上一次列印手稿是很多本書之前了，他會在電腦上做完所有的編輯修改工作，也在電腦上閱讀。

en: He figured he was helping save the environment.
zh: 他認為這有助於環保。

en: He reads the first few pages.
zh: 他讀了前幾頁。

en: Are you kidding me?
zh: 「你在跟我開玩笑嗎？」

en: Henry asks, and Jerry is thinking the same thing.
zh: 亨利問，傑瑞心裏也閃爍著同樣的問題。

en: By the time he gets to the end of chapter one, his heart is pounding in his chest. He wants to scream. He wants to go back to where they left Eric and shake him from the collar and ask him why he would do this.
zh: 看完第一章結束，他的心臟狂奔亂跳，他想大聲尖叫，想回到他們丟棄艾瑞克的地方，撕扯他的衣領問他為什麼要這樣做。

en: He carries the manuscript through the house until he finds Hans in the garage, where he’s searching a set of shelves that are home to paint trays and brushes and sandpaper.
zh: 他拿著手稿穿過房子，在車庫裡找到漢斯，他正在那裡搜著一個貨架，那上面放著油漆托盤、刷子和砂紙。

en: “Jesus, you look like somebody just walked all over your grave,” Hans says.
zh: 「天哪，你看上去像是有人經過了你的墳墓。」漢斯說。

en: “This opening chapter,” he says, struggling to keep his voice even, a struggle he loses, “is about a crime writer who has Alzheimer’s.”
zh: 他努力使他的聲音保持平靜，「寫的是患有阿爾茨海默病的犯罪小說家。」

en: He waits for the appropriate reaction from Hans, which he doesn’t get, because he thinks Hans should be throwing things across the garage. He carries on.
zh: 他等待漢斯做出適當反應，以為漢斯會把手上的東西扔出車庫，但漢斯毫無反應。

en: “This guy, this guy starts confessing to crimes that he thinks he’s committed.”
zh: 他繼續說道：「這傢伙，這個傢伙承認自己犯過罪了，他認為他犯下了罪行。」

en: “I more than just inspired him!”
zh: 「是你啟發了他。」「我不只啟發他！」

en: Jerry says, and starts shaking his head, annoyed Hans is acting like it’s no big deal. Dropping Eric on his head doesn’t make him feel as bad as it did a few minutes ago. “He’s taken all the bad shit that’s happening to me and used it to try and get a book contract.”
zh: 傑瑞搖著頭說，漢斯毫不在意的反應讓他十分惱火，比幾分鐘前讓艾瑞克頭朝下摔下去時的感覺還要糟糕，「他盜用了發生在我身上的所有倒霉事，把它寫成一本書出版！」

en: “There anything in there about sneaking into people’s houses and framing the author?”
zh: 「他有沒有寫過偷偷進入別人家的房子，並且栽贓陷害作家？」

en: Jerry’s anger subsides as he thinks about it, then his heart starts to race with the possibility. There could be some answers in here.
zh: 傑瑞思忖著，他的怒火平息下來，察覺到有這種可能，他的心跳開始加速，問題的答案會在後文中。

en: “I’ll keep reading,” he says, then looks at the beginning of chapter two.
zh: 「我繼續往下讀。」他說，開始讀第二章的開頭。

en: He reads a couple of paragraphs while leaning against the doorframe.
zh: 他靠在門框上一口氣讀了好幾段。

en: Hans watches him.
zh: 漢斯看著他。

en: “Oh no,” Jerry says.
zh: 「哦，不。」傑瑞說。

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “Give me a minute,” Jerry says.
zh: 「再給我一分鐘。」傑瑞說。

en: “Jerry—”
“A minute.”
zh: 「一分鐘。」

en: He reads the chapter. Hans moves to the next shelf along.
zh: 他讀著這一章，漢斯走到下一個貨架。

en: A few minutes later Jerry turns the manuscript towards his friend.
zh: 幾分鐘后，傑瑞把手稿交給他的朋友。

en: “Look,” he says.
zh: 他說，「你看！」

en: “Look!”
“What am I looking at?”
zh: 「讓我看什麼？」

en: Hans asks, coming over.
zh: 漢斯走過來問。

en: Jerry points to the chapter heading. It says “Day Who Knows.” He’s looking at a chapter entry set in a nursing home. The entry is in the form of a diary.
zh: 傑瑞用手指著章節標題，上面寫著「誰知道是哪一天」，這一章以療養院為背景，是用日記的形式寫成的，因為主角有一本「狂人日記」。

en: The main character is keeping a Madness Journal. The main character’s name is Gerald Black, and Gerald has no idea how long he’s been in the home. However, Gerald’s words sound exactly like Jerry’s. In fact so much like Jerry’s own words that he knows they are his own.
zh: 主角的名字是傑拉爾德·布萊克，傑拉爾德不知道自己在療養院住了多久，可傑拉爾德說的話完全像是出自傑瑞之口，就是傑瑞自己說的話，他知道那些話是他說的。

en: He has written them, but he doesn’t remember when.
zh: 他寫過，但不記得是在什麼時候寫的。

en: The sense of betrayal is so strong he feels like tossing Eric out the window all over again.
zh: 他有一種強烈的遭人背叛的感覺，他想把艾瑞克再一次扔到窗外。

en: Hans takes the manuscript and reads.
zh: 漢斯拿著手稿，讀著。

en: “This is you,” he says.
zh: 「這寫的是你。」他說。

en: Jerry starts pacing the garage. “Eric has my journal.”
zh: 傑瑞開始在車庫裡來回踱步：「艾瑞克拿了我的日記。」

en: Hans looks up from the pages. “What?”
zh: 漢斯從書稿上抬起頭：「什麼？」

en: “Those are my words. I recognize them.
zh: 「這些是我說過的話，我太熟悉了。

en: Somehow he got hold of my journal, and he’s been using it to create that,” he says, nodding towards the manuscript.
zh: 他不知用什麼方法拿走了我的日記，他一直在利用它創作。」他朝著手稿點點頭。

en: Hans reads for a few more seconds, then looks back up at Jerry. “Are you sure?”
zh: 漢斯讀了幾秒鐘，回頭看看傑瑞：「你確定嗎？」

en: “It’s the ultimate Write what you know,” Jerry says.
zh: 「這完美演繹了『寫下你知道的』。」傑瑞說，「日記一定在某個地方。」

en: He closes his eyes and puts his fist against his forehead. He taps it lightly a few times.
zh: 他閉上眼睛，把拳頭抵在額頭上，輕輕敲了幾下。

en: “I must have had the journal all along at the home. I don’t know.
zh: 「我一定是把日記帶到療養院了，我不知道。

en: But those are my words,” Jerry says, pointing at the manuscript. “Not all of them, not whatever is stringing the plot together, but some of them. Somehow Eric got hold of it.”
zh: 傑瑞說著指指手稿，「不是所有的原話，不是所有的情節，只是其中一些被艾瑞克採用了。」

en: “How?
zh: 「他怎麼拿到的？

en: If the police couldn’t find it, how did he?”
zh: 要是連警察都找不到，他是怎麼拿到的？」

en: “I don’t know. All I know is that he has it.”
zh: 「我不知道，我只知道他弄到手了。」

en: Hans hands him back the manuscript. “Okay, so the orderly took your journal and used it for his story, and if it’s here we need to find it.”
zh: 漢斯遞給他手稿：「好吧，所以護理員拿走了你的日記，用於創作他的故事，如果它就在這裏，我們需要找到它。」

en: “And proof that he’s a killer,” Jerry says.
zh: 「證明他是兇手。」傑瑞說。

en: “That’s what we’re looking for. But we really need that journal.
zh: 「這就是我們要找的，我們真的需要這本日記。

en: If he’s taking it back and forth from the nursing home,” Hans says, “it could be in his car. I’ll give it a thorough search.”
zh: 如果他往返于療養院時拿著日記，」漢斯說，「很有可能還在他的車裡，我要徹底搜查一遍。」

en: Hans opens the car and starts going through it.
zh: 漢斯打開車門搜查。

en: Jerry heads back down to the study. He sits behind Eric’s desk. He switches on the computer.
zh: 傑瑞回到書房，他坐在艾瑞克的書桌後面，打開電腦。

en: While it’s booting up, he goes through the closet where there are some clothes hanging and some boxes on the ground. He starts pulling them out.
zh: 等著電腦開機時他翻查衣櫃，裏面掛著一些衣服，底部放著盒子，他把它們拖了出來。

en: He hears Hans walking down the hallway back towards him.
zh: 他聽到漢斯從走廊向他走來。

en: He opens one of the boxes to find a bunch of bank and mortgage statements.
zh: 他打開一個盒子，發現一堆銀行賬單和抵押貸款報表。

en: “Who the hell are you?”
zh: 「你是誰？」

en: It’s a woman’s voice, and it startles him, and he turns towards it.
zh: 這是個女人的聲音，他嚇了一跳，轉過頭去。

en: He’s never seen her before, but he knows it has to be Eric’s wife.
zh: 他從未見過她，但他知道這一定是艾瑞克的妻子。

en: Before he can answer, Hans steps in behind her and pushes a needle into the side of her neck.
zh: 還沒等他回答，漢斯就已經出現在她身後，將針頭刺入她脖子的一側。

en: She doesn’t even have time to struggle. It only takes a couple of seconds, and then she’s asleep, Hans lowering her gently to the ground.
zh: 她甚至來不及反抗掙扎，只過了幾秒鐘，她就睡著了。

en: “Holy shit,” Jerry says, jumping to his feet.
zh: 「媽的。」傑瑞跳起腳說道。

en: “She’ll be fine,” Hans says.
zh: 「她會沒事的。」漢斯說，「看看我發現了什麼。」

en: “But look what I found,” he adds, and he tosses a book towards him. Jerry catches it and opens it up.
zh: 他向他扔過來一本書，傑瑞一把抓住打開它。

en: It’s a journal, but not his Madness Journal. Only in some ways it is.
zh: 這是一本日記，但不是他的「狂人日記」，只是在某些方面有相同之處。

en: There are no eyes on the cover.
zh: 但封面上沒有眼睛。

en: “It starts from your time in the nursing home,” Hans says. “Which means the original is still out there, and we still really need to find it.”
zh: 「這是你從住進療養院時開始寫的，」漢斯說，「這說明前一本仍然在那裡，我們需要找到它。」
